series.title: Building Eldertree
series.subtitle: The real journey of running Kubernetes on Raspberry Pis
series.description: A documentary podcast series following the complete journey of building a highly available Kubernetes cluster on Raspberry Pi hardware. From initial setup through production deployment, including all the failures, troubleshooting, and lessons learned along the way. Perfect for DevOps engineers, SRE professionals, and anyone interested in Kubernetes or home lab setups.
series.author: Rafael Oliveira

episodes.title: The Beginning
episodes.subtitle: Setting up the Pi cluster hardware
episodes.description: The journey begins. We unbox three Raspberry Pi 5 units, set up the hardware, and take our first steps toward building a home Kubernetes cluster.

episodes.title: NVMe Migration
episodes.subtitle: Moving from SD cards to NVMe storage
episodes.description: SD cards are slow and unreliable. We migrate the entire cluster to NVMe SSDs and discover that boot configuration is an art form.

episodes.title: Network Nightmares
episodes.subtitle: DNS, firewall, and connectivity battles
episodes.description: Networking will break your cluster. We battle DNS issues, firewall misconfigurations, and packets being silently dropped.

episodes.title: The Flux Bootstrap
episodes.subtitle: GitOps with Flux CD
episodes.description: We embrace GitOps by bootstrapping Flux CD. Cluster configuration now lives in Git, and deployments happen automatically.

episodes.title: Storage Wars
episodes.subtitle: Longhorn distributed storage journey
episodes.description: Local storage fails when nodes go down. We attempt Longhorn, fail, give up, come back, and finally achieve distributed storage.

episodes.title: Secrets & Vaults
episodes.subtitle: HashiCorp Vault setup and HA
episodes.description: Secrets management with HashiCorp Vault. We learn about unsealing, integrate External Secrets, and achieve HA with Raft.

episodes.title: The HA Quest
episodes.subtitle: Converting to 3-node high availability
episodes.description: The big one. Converting single control plane to 3-node HA. etcd quorum, kube-vip, and testing failover by shutting down node-1.

episodes.title: When Everything Breaks
episodes.subtitle: Troubleshooting war stories
episodes.description: Our greatest hits in cluster disasters. Emergency mode recovery, locked accounts, and times we couldn't SSH into anything.

episodes.title: The Monitoring Stack
episodes.subtitle: Prometheus, Grafana, observability
episodes.description: What good is a cluster without visibility? We deploy Prometheus, Grafana, and build dashboards that actually help.

episodes.title: Production Ready
episodes.subtitle: Final architecture and lessons learned
episodes.description: The finale. Final architecture, real application deployment, Cloudflare Tunnel, and all the lessons we learned.
